sen.j: 喜多六平太（きた ろっぺいた、1874年7月7日 - 1971年1月11日）は、喜多流能楽師で、喜多流十四世宗家。
sen.e: Roppeita KITA (July 7, 1874 - January 11, 1971) was Noh actor of the Kita school and the fourteenth head family of Kita school.
Roppeita KITA (July 7, 1874 - January 11, 1971) was a Noh actor of the Kita school and the fourteenth head family of Kita school.
Roppeita KITA (July 7, 1874 - January 11, 1971) was a Noh actor of the Kita school and the fourteenth head family of Kita school.
He was born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 初名は千代造、元の名字は宇都野。
sen.e: He first named Chiyozo and his original myoji (family name) was Utsuno.
His first name was Chiyozo and his original myoji (family name) was Utsuno.
sen.cmt: His first named をHis first name was に変更。
sen.e: His first name was Chiyozo and his original myoji (family name) was Utsuno.

sen.j: 旧幕臣・宇都野鶴五郎と、十二世喜多六平太（能静）の三女・まつの間の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son between Tsurugoro UTSUNO, the former retainer of shogun, and Matsu, the third daughter of the twelfth Roppeita KITA (Nojo).
He was the second son between Tsurugoro UTSUNO, a former retainer of shogun, and Matsu, the third daughter of the twelfth Roppeita KITA (Nojo).
sen.cmt: the formerを a formerに変更。
sen.e: He was the second son between Tsurugoro UTSUNO, a former retainer of shogun, and Matsu, the third daughter of the twelfth Roppeita KITA (Nojo).

sen.j: 1879年喜多家に入り、1884年10歳で14代目宗家を継承し、1894年六平太を襲名する。
sen.e: He entered the Kita family in 1879, succeeded to the fourteenth head family at the age of ten in 1884, and succeeded to Roppeita in 1894.
He entered the Kita family in 1879, succeeded to the fourteenth head family at the age of ten in 1884, and succeeded to Roppeita in 1894.
He entered the Kita family in 1879, succeeded to the fourteenth head family at the age of ten in 1884, and succeeded to Roppeita in 1894.

sen.j: 新しい技法は取り入れず、伝統的な芸風を維持し、昭和を代表する名人となった。
sen.e: He did not bring in a new technique and became the leading master in Showa period by maintaining traditional style of performance.
He did not bring in a new technique and became the leading master in the Showa period by maintaining the traditional style of performance.
He did not bring in a new technique and became the leading master in the Showa period by maintaining the traditional style of performance.

sen.j: 1943年能楽協会の設立委員を務める。
sen.e: He served as a foundation member of the Noh Association in 1943.
He served as a foundation member of the Noh Association in 1943.
He served as a foundation member of the Noh Association in 1943.
He became the member of the Japan Art Academy in 1947.
He became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1947.
sen.cmt: the menberを a memberに変更
sen.e: He became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1947.
He was given the Order of Culture in 1953.
He was given the Order of Culture in 1953.
He was given the Order of Culture in 1953.

sen.j: 1955年重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）に認定。
sen.e: He was recognized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1955.
He was recognized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1955.
He was recognized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1955.
One of his important works was "Roppeita Geidan" (Roppeita's Thinking on the Arts).
One of his important works was "Roppeita Geidan" (Roppeita's Thinking on the Arts).
One of his important works was "Roppeita Geidan" (Roppeita's Thinking on the Arts).

sen.j: 妻は囲碁の女流棋士 (囲碁)である喜多文子（旧姓林）。
sen.e: His wife was Fumiko KITA (her maiden name was Hayashi) who was female professional go player.
His wife was Fumiko KITA (her maiden name was Hayashi), who was a female professional go player.
sen.cmt: female professional go player に冠詞aを付与
sen.e: His wife was Fumiko KITA (her maiden name was Hayashi), who was a female professional go player.

sen.j: 実子はなく、養子に後藤家より喜多実（喜多流十五世宗家）。
sen.e: He didn't have any biological child, so he adopted Minoru KITA (the fifteenth head family of Kita school) from the Goto family.
He did not have any biological child, and adopted Minoru KITA (the fifteenth head family of Kita school) from the Goto family.
sen.cmt: didn't を did not に変更
sen.e: He did not have any biological child, and adopted Minoru KITA (the fifteenth head family of Kita school) from the Goto family.
